title: How do you not get bored of being a one trick?

replies.body: I only ARAM, what is a main?
A main is a champ that u have either mastered or play a lot.

> [{quoted}](name=JHarV,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=luX40rrV,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-01-07T07:45:28.970+0000)
>
> A main is a champ that u have either mastered or play a lot.

Wow!

Thanks for the definition, you clearly understood my post well.

Well, as a 1 trick thresh (400k+) i find that playing him with strange builds (ie. Top full ad/tank, AP Supp, Mid AP/Hybrid. or ADC) improves the fun factor, plus ruining a yasuo/lee/ali/leo's day amuses me to no end (regardless of position)

But changing it up often helps, i play a fair amount of mid/top as well, so if i get bored of him, i swap out for other champs (i have mastery 3+ on EVERY champ, and every supp (across multiple accounts) at Mastery 7
When I was a Sion main I would take him top with rejuvenation beads and then build into GLP. Go full hybrid like that. It was awesome and nobody knew how to play against it.

At least your main champion is in a decent spot.

I'd love to get back into nidalee but it's just not fun to do her early game for me (because you have god awful jungle clears that require massive micro managing, or you try and lane her and have a shit time losing most matchups)

And even while not playing her, she still sits at my 3rd highest mastery points (63k).

Personally i would recommend having 2-5 mains if your getting bored from just having 1, it will take longer, but you will get there, as i currently have fairly decent mastery scores on Ekko and Thresh considering i don't always play them.

It's hard for you to do this but since I main Lux, I can take her as supp. You can also just do some commentary over your own gameplay just to hype yourself up.  It also helps to go on youtube to watch some educational videos about League so you can learn some new tricks and try them in-game
No idea, I can barely play the same champion for a week in a row.
